poem:
The Exchange

In the morning paper,
the torch is passed
from one guardian to another,
each name a syllable
in democracy's long sentence.

Yet, in the quiet of dawn,
it's the blue jay on my windowsill
and the coffee's first steam
that seem to risk everything
to protect
an ordinary moment.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Secret Service director resigns after assassination attempt at Trump rally – live 3.59pm BST Biden says he will appoint new Secret Service director 'soon' In a brief statement, Joe Biden thanked Kimberly Cheatle for her tenure as director of the Secret Service, and said he would soon appoint her replacement. “Jill and I are grateful to Director Kim Cheatle for her decades of public service. She has selflessly dedicated and risked her life to protect". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
